| A cultist:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                   |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | [EvilHack - monst.c, line 4182](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/master/src/monst.c#L4182) |

A **cultist**, @, is a [Infidel](/wiki/Infidel "Infidel") [quest guardian](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian") in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). They have [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") as player Infidels do.

## Generation

Eight cultists are generated on the home level of the [Infidel quest](/wiki/Infidel_quest "Infidel quest"), stationed within the hidden temple at level creation.

A cultist [will generate with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") either a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") (2⁄3 chance) or a [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife") (1⁄3 chance), along with a 4⁄5 chance of either a [jacket](/wiki/Leather_jacket "Leather jacket") (2⁄3 chance) or a [cloak](/wiki/Leather_cloak "Leather cloak") (1⁄3 chance), a 2⁄3 chance of either [low boots](/wiki/Low_boots "Low boots") (2⁄3 chance) or [high boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots") (1⁄3 chance), and a 2⁄3 chance of a [potion of healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing").

## Encyclopedia entry

We must especially observe that this heresy, witchcraft, not only  
differs from all other heresy in this, that not merely by a tacit  
compact, but by a compact which is exactly defined and expressed  
it blasphemes the Creator and endeavours to the utmost to profane Him  
and to harm His creatures, for all other simple heresies have made  
no open compact with the devil, no compact, that is, either tacit  
or exactly expressed, although their errors and misbelief are directly  
to be attributed to the Father of errors and lies. Moreover,  
maleficium (witchcraft) differs from all other harmful and mysterious  
arts in this point, that of all superstition it is essentially  
the vilest, the most evil and the worst, wherefore it derives its name  
from doing evil, and from blaspheming the true faith.  
\[ The Malleus Maleficarum, translated by Montague Summers ]
html:
Cultist

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ cultist (No tile)
Difficulty 7
Attacks Weapon 1d6
@ cultist (No tile)
Difficulty 7
Attacks

Weapon 1d6

Base level 5
Base experience 31
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 10
Alignment A_NONE
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances fire
Resistances conveyed None

A cultist:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 4182

A cultist, @, is a Infidel quest guardian in EvilHack and Hack'EM. They have fire resistance as player Infidels do.

Generation

Eight cultists are generated on the home level of the Infidel quest, stationed within the hidden temple at level creation.

A cultist will generate with either a dagger (2⁄3 chance) or a knife (1⁄3 chance), along with a 4⁄5 chance of either a jacket (2⁄3 chance) or a cloak (1⁄3 chance), a 2⁄3 chance of either low boots (2⁄3 chance) or high boots (1⁄3 chance), and a 2⁄3 chance of a potion of healing.

Encyclopedia entry

We must especially observe that this heresy, witchcraft, not only
differs from all other heresy in this, that not merely by a tacit
compact, but by a compact which is exactly defined and expressed
it blasphemes the Creator and endeavours to the utmost to profane Him
and to harm His creatures, for all other simple heresies have made
no open compact with the devil, no compact, that is, either tacit
or exactly expressed, although their errors and misbelief are directly
to be attributed to the Father of errors and lies. Moreover,
maleficium (witchcraft) differs from all other harmful and mysterious
arts in this point, that of all superstition it is essentially
the vilest, the most evil and the worst, wherefore it derives its name
from doing evil, and from blaspheming the true faith.
[ The Malleus Maleficarum, translated by Montague Summers ]

A {{varquestmon|cultist|Infidel|guardian|EvilHack|Hack'EM}}. They have [[fire resistance]] as player Infidels do.

==Generation==
Eight cultists are generated on the home level of the [[Infidel quest]], stationed within the hidden temple at level creation.

A cultist [[Monster starting inventory|will generate with]] either a [[dagger]] ({{frac|2|3}} chance) or a [[knife]] ({{frac|3}} chance), along with a {{frac|4|5}} chance of either a [[Leather jacket|jacket]] ({{frac|2|3}} chance) or a [[Leather cloak|cloak]] ({{frac|3}} chance), a {{frac|2|3}} chance of either [[low boots]] ({{frac|2|3}} chance) or [[high boots]] ({{frac|3}} chance), and a {{frac|2|3}} chance of a [[potion of healing]].
